content.description: Quorum sensing is a form of cell-to-cell communication used by some bacterial species to regulate their behavior and population size. Staphylococcus aureus uses quorum sensing to activate its virulence genes once its population reaches a minimum size. Virulence refers to the ability of a pathogen to cause disease.
content.question: S. aureus secretes autoinducing peptide <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(AIP)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which binds to the <math alttext="A g r C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AgrC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> receptor on the bacterial cell membrane. When the S. aureus population is sufficiently large and produces enough <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, this concentration activates <math alttext="A g r C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AgrC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and stimulates a signal cascade resulting in the production of hemolysin, a toxin used to attack the host organism. In order to lessen the impact of the toxin produced by an S. aureus infection on patients, scientists created <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> mimics intended to act as competitive inhibitors of <math alttext="A I P dash A g r C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext><mo>âˆ’</mo><mtext>AgrC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> binding at the cell surface. Figure 1. <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> cascade producing hemolysin toxin Identify the experimental design that would determine which <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext></mrow></math> mimic would most effectively inhibit the production of hemolysin toxin.

choices.label: Grow S. aureus in separate culture media containing one <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> mimic each and measure the amount of <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> mimic transported into the cells. The most effective <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> mimic will be absorbed the fastest.

Grow S. aureus in separate culture media containing one <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> mimic each and measure the production of hemolysin toxin. The most effective <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> mimic will be in the culture producing the lowest amount of hemolysin.

Grow S. aureus in culture media containing hemolysin and measure the production of <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> mimic in response to hemolysin intake. The most effective <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> mimic will be produced in the highest amount.

Grow S. aureus in separate culture media containing one <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> mimic each and measure the amount of live cells in each culture. The most effective <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> mimic will be the one that killed the most S. aureus.

The most effective <math alttext="A I P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AIP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> mimic will be in the culture producing the lowest amount of hemolysin.
